page.title: 15HOME LIFE 2 BRAE
page.content: In the past people did not have freezers so they used salt to pickle their meat and fish to preserve them. SALT FISH Gut the fresh fish and wash them well in cold water.Take a handful of rock salt and sprinkle over the bottom of the basin.Lay the fish in layers with their backs down until the basin is nearly full.Cover each layer with plenty of salt making sure salt goes inside the stomachs of the fish. Leave for three days then take out the fish.Tie two fish together by their tails.Hang outside in good weather on the fence or clothes line.Dry above the fire inside for roughly two weeks. soak over night in water then boil on the top of potatoes
